instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Hi, i have a macbook pro here, my client trying to solve a wifi problem, burn the lvds conector and the lvds flex .. i reeplace thad but after replace, to remove the excess of flux i put the board in the ultrasonic and before that.. no turns on anymore. in any moment before the ultrasonic shows a green light and orange.. but in a moment taking a measures accidentaly touch the pin 1 of the C6999 and pin 1 of the R6905 and the light is gone. so.. there is my measures

PP3V42_G3H 3,35v
PPBUS_G3H 12,23v
PPDCIN 18,71v
SMC_BC_ACOK 1,14v

i replace the U7000 and have same result.. any sugestions?

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
what cleaner do you have?
Rewind 3 years, i killed allot of chipsets in substandard cleaners. what ultrasonic cleaner do you have.
Maybe 2/10 repairs would go into the cleaner working and come out dead.
I mean fully dead, quater fan spin dead (due to bad PCH's)

In the case of MCP79's and 89's id get no S4/3
If this board isnt liquid related your cleaner/or fluid has probably killed the MCP, sounds silly but i spent allot of time messing with fluids and a cheap cleaner.
I used some pink stuff once and a working board came out of my crest with a bad PCH.

ehm, i use Brason, and the ultrasonic cleaner is a cheap one.. "VEVOR" ..

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Have you had this issue before?
Are you 100% its non liquid damaged? In some cases bad but semi intact probe points will loose connection during the cleaning cycle

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: im pretty sure this is not a liquid damage.

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Okay, ACOK is 1.14V so how do you have a green light, It could be something to do with that.
Does it work in SMC bypass?
Thanks
Zac

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: how can do a sms bypass? just for proof.. i dont have greenlight

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
You can google a SMC bypass, it bypasses certain function of SMC's
Its just holding the power button for 10 seconds before attaching a power source (such as a battery or charger)

anyway with ACOK low id suggest replacing the ISL6259

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: ok, i will try replace isl6259 again.. see later and say u how im going

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: You killed the SMC by shorting out 3V42 to something. This in most cases kills the MCP too. Toast I say.

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 22585"]You killed the SMC by shorting out 3V42 to something. This in most cases kills the MCP too. Toast I say.[/QUOTE]

Oh god.. so, any solution? replace the SMC? i never did replace any before.. too hard?

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: You replace the SMC and the MCP89 will be dead as well.

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 22592"]You replace the SMC and the MCP89 will be dead as well. [/QUOTE]

So, you say this board is totally dead already?

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
replace smc and see if you killed the rest of the shit,
ppbus_g3h at 12,23volt most times say SMC is dead.

threads.title: 820-2879 no power after ultrasonic.
threads.message: Remove SMC then measure resistance to GND on the 3V42 rail and report the value here. I'm pretty sure this board will be fucked.
